title: Multinationals Fret Over Foreign Tax Credits as U.S. Tightens Rules
sub_head: Owners of Pizza Hut and Burger King are analyzing regulations as analysts warn about impact on businesses operating in Brazil
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The owners of Pizza Hut, Burger King and Outback Steakhouse are alerting investors about a potential threat to profits: foreign tax credit rules.
The restaurant chains and other multinational companies said in recent securities filings that they are analyzing complicated new Treasury Department rules. The regulations, which limit when companies can claim U.S. tax credits for paying foreign taxes, were released in December and are now in effect.
